polished_script:
HOOK: Ten months of postcards. Zero calls. Almost bankrupt. [ON-SCREEN: 10 MONTHS • 0 CALLS]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: Jay Cannone is a top 1% producer now, but back then he was broke. Sitting on agent calls listening to everyone else celebrate deals while he had nothing. [ON-SCREEN: TOP 1% NOW • BROKE THEN] He was ready to quit his entire marketing strategy after ten months of sending postcards with zero response.
[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: But month eleven changed everything—and the reason why will shock you.

INSIGHT: Month eleven, a luxury seller finally calls. Jay asks, "Why me?" The seller says: "Anybody who sends me these postcards as consistently as you've done for the past ten months—that's who I want to work with." [ON-SCREEN: "CONSISTENCY = TRUST"] It wasn't the prettiest design or cleverest copy. The seller had been watching, testing, waiting to see if Jay would quit like everyone else. [ON-SCREEN: THEY'RE ALWAYS WATCHING]

REFRAME: You think nobody's noticing your marketing, but they are. They're just not ready yet. Every postcard, email, and video is a deposit in your credibility account. The clients worth having? They're counting to see who sticks around. [ON-SCREEN: EVERY TOUCHPOINT = DEPOSIT]

CTA: "What marketing strategy did you quit on at month nine?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."

---

CAPTION: He almost quit at month 10. Month 11 changed his entire career. The lesson? They're always watching—even when they're not responding.

HASHTAGS: #RealEstateMarketing #Consistency #AgentTips #MarketingStrategy #RealEstateSuccess

SHAREABLE_MOMENT: "Every postcard, email, and video is a deposit in your credibility account—and the clients worth having are counting."

PERFORMANCE_NOTES: 
1. HOOK: Deliver with urgency, slight pause between each phrase for impact
2. INSIGHT: Slow down on the quote—make it feel conversational, like you're sharing a secret
3. REFRAME: Build intensity through "They're counting"—this is the mic drop moment
